summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Elmwood Place, in the City of Seattle, from Bradner Place to a connection with the existing sewer in Twenty-seventh Avenue South, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all manholes, flush tanks, catch basins and other appurtenance necessary for the proper sewering and draining of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1450 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
